intro: Thysanospermum diffusum var. longitubum, commonly known as the long-tubed thysanospermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and trifoliate leaves with a glossy surface. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and arranged in dense clusters, typical of the legume family. The fruit is a legume pod that matures into a fibrous, woody structure. This plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
